Class MultipleChoice

java.lang.Object
Questionnaire
MultipleChoice
public class MultipleChoice
extends Questionnaire
Derived from 'Questionnaire', the MultipleChoice class will ask a multiple-choice question, and store a given answer as an integer.
Since:
2/27/2021
Author:
Austin Piper
See Also:
Questionnaire

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.String[] options
    This array contains all of the given options for a MultipleChoiceQuestion
    private int response
    The response to a MultipleChoice question is stored as an integer.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    MultipleChoice​(java.lang.String input_question, java.lang.String[] input_options)
    The constructor receives and sets the question to be asked (as a String), as well as the possible options to choose from (as a String array),

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void obtainResponse​(java.lang.String input_response)
    This abstract method is implemented differently by each subclass, and stores a given answer as appropriate.
    java.lang.String showResponse()
    Returns the value of 'response' in String format

  • Field Details

    • response

      private int response
      The response to a MultipleChoice question is stored as an integer. This is so that numerical calculations can be done with MultipleChoice questions if desired.

    • options

      private java.lang.String[] options
      This array contains all of the given options for a MultipleChoiceQuestion

  • Constructor Details

    • MultipleChoice

      MultipleChoice​(java.lang.String input_question, java.lang.String[] input_options)
      The constructor receives and sets the question to be asked (as a String), as well as the possible options to choose from (as a String array),
      Parameters:
      input_question - The question to be asked
      input_options - The possible options given for the question

  • Method Details

    • obtainResponse

      public void obtainResponse​(java.lang.String input_response)
      Description copied from class: Questionnaire
      This abstract method is implemented differently by each subclass, and stores a given answer as appropriate.
      Specified by:
      obtainResponse in class Questionnaire
      Parameters:
      input_response - The answer given to the question (typically by a user)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - An exception will be thrown if the given response cannot be converted into a positive integer. Note that it is still possible to give a response that does not correspond to a given answer (for instance, responding with '5' even though the question only has 4 options). This is intentional, because an irregular answer may still prove useful to a survey-giver

    • showResponse

      public java.lang.String showResponse()
      Returns the value of 'response' in String format
      Specified by:
      showResponse in class Questionnaire
      Returns:
      The value of the 'response' integer in String form
